最好跟足老任自己啲使用條款同埋版權警告字眼

以下係另一個template

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to report a Facebok page "亂港小精靈系列" (@PKMonHK) (https://bit.ly/2ZuJga2 ) that allegedly distributes political propaganda mimicking Pokémon merchandise, thus violating the copyright policy of Pokemon and Nintendo (https://www.nintendo.com/corp/legal.jsp )

Some examples of the counterfeit provided by the page itself (https://bit.ly/2DQ5HOR ) clearly depicted pictures and remarks of Hong Kong politicians in a manner similar to Pokemon Go interface. This can mislead the public into believing that Nintendo/Pokemon endorsed the political stance of this Facebook page.



The Facebook page also sets up a Google form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfl5pVlYhpmfCcCUvm11GETrabb_ACpTCLNyjJFCTgeX9E6lw/viewform ) which harvests or collects the email addresses or other contact information of users for the probable future purpose of sending spam or other commercial messages, as you can see in the screenshot below.



As stated clearly in your company's legal info (https://www.pokemon.com/us/legal/ ), in no uncertain terms does Pokémon's use of Fan Art constitute a grant to Fan Art's creator to use the Pokémon intellectual property or Fan Art beyond a personal, noncommercial home use. It is beyond doubt that the use of Pokemon Fan Art as political propaganda does not count as "personal" and "home use".

Infringement of Nintendo's IP rights hurts not only Nintendo, but also players and the legitimate businesses connected with Nintendo. Counterfeiting is a serious problem not only for Nintendo but also the entire video game industry. It is thus hoped that due action may be taken in response to such blatant piracy.

Yours faithfully,
